Testing 2.md.title: This is a test to show how the **Task Board Safe Guard** feature will ensure your local changes will never going to be overwritten by **Task Board**. üìÖ 2025-07-27 #Test
body: - This is a normal line in description added by you in the current device through Obsidian.

- This is a line which you have updated either from another device or another plugin silently added this line. Hence **Task Board** couldnt able to scan it and hence its not present in the *task-board-memory* when it last time scanned it.
- Also, this feature will scan character by character.
- ![[Pasted image 20250727115440.png]]

- [ ] Incase you are **Synching** across devices, you should use the `Task cache file path` setting and change the Task Board cache file path to somewhere inside your vault, so it gets synched as well.

body: Basically with this new sessionStorage feature, i will now have to trace how the tasks are getting loaded and refreshed on the board, because with the refresh button the tasks are getting updated. But after i edit any task, or checkbox change, or anything else. The **REFRESH_COLUMN** command is not working properly.
One probable solution i can think of is, because now everything is asynchronous, thats why this shit is happening.
- [ ] Trace how you code is running for the *REFRESH_COLUMN*  command.
- [x] Accordingly update the code to get smooth refresh and not hard refresh like REFRESH_BOARD. Updated
- [ ] A sub-sub Task for the first time. updating.
